alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 4:33PM EDT until July 12 at 6:20AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Belknap, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Carroll and Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen throughout the advisory area today and light to occasionally moderate rainfall may continue into early this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claremont, Lebanon, Franklin, Henniker, New London, Plymouth, Meredith, Moultonborough, Grafton and Hanover.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
